sentences.english: They are the first to smell the sweet new grasses and the willow catkins.
sentences.chinese: 他們是聞甜的新草和柳樹柳絮花的第一。

sentences.english: High willows ranged along the highway.
sentences.chinese: 高大的柳樹排列在公路兩旁。

sentences.english: Josh joins her and she leads him by the hand to the center of the stand of willows.
sentences.chinese: 傑克跟着她，她用手牽着他來到柳樹羣的中心位置。

sentences.english: Their trunks are as gnarled as bonsai.
sentences.chinese: 這些柳樹的樹幹盤根錯雜，彷彿盆景一般。

sentences.english: Willow has good resistance and is especially suitable for landscaping.
sentences.chinese: 柳樹的抗性極好，特別適合用於園林綠化。

sentences.english: Where does the gracefulness of the willow sprays result from?
sentences.chinese: 春天柳樹枝葉的優雅是怎麼來的呢？

sentences.english: The ground was low and covered with a second growth of grey-green willows.
sentences.chinese: 地勢很低窪，長滿了人工種下的灰綠色的柳樹。

sentences.english: Willows are planted on both sides of the streets.
sentences.chinese: 每條水渠旁都種了柳樹和果樹。

sentences.english: The path is landscaped with willows along its two sides.
sentences.chinese: 小路兩旁柳樹成行，景色宜人。

sentences.english: The willow trees have begun to bud.
It is the Willow Tree Kingdom that addresses you today.
sentences.chinese: 今天是柳樹王國向你們講述。

sentences.english: Willows are planted on both sides of the streets.
The peach trees were interspersed among the willows.
During this time of year, willow and poplar tree catkins fill the air.
sentences.chinese: 在今年這時，楊柳樹的飛絮遍佈空氣中。

sentences.english: Finally they found Jie and his mother scorched under a willow.
sentences.chinese: 最後他們發現傑和他的母親燒焦的柳樹下。

definition: fence (esp. of bamboo or wood railings)
